column4: My son and I were recently at the Hilton Tanger for 5 nights. We had an excellent stay, mainly due to the wonderful staff. We especially appreciated the assistance we received from Sara and from Yassine Al Boulhi. They were both very helpful, polite, and kind, giving us a lot of logistical information about beautiful Tangier and day trips. Their assistance went above and beyond. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed their nice cookie holiday assortment. We will stay again if we visit Tangier again soon. Thanks you, J & A

Stayed last few days of May, as Morocco was coming out of many of the restrictions in place. With tourism opening up, this was our first hotel on our trip, and as Diamond members we were welcomed as expected. Executive lounge was closed, but we were given vouchers for the Kasbar lounge instead, and the bartender took care of us, during the evening social times and made it extremely pleasant as we wound down from our daytime touring. I felt like we may have been the only Diamond members staying but that is to be expected with tourism so far down. Our morning breakfast was inviting each day, and the staff was always available to help. Front desk, and every staff member generally seemed happy and ready to help us although our needs were pretty low. Location was great and‚Ä¶

We had to book last minute since our Riad had a plumbing issue. We stayed in this beautiful property and although a complete change of plan, honestly it was a true treat. The restaurants were excellent, the breakfast specially. The service top notch. The room super spacious, stunning lightning options, beautiful washrooms. Highly recommend this place.

Really good hotel. Great check in , great breakfast, great dining and great bar. Overall very nice people working here. The staff was really good. We specially impressed by the concierge service who took special care to make our stay comfortable.

The service here is outstanding. We checked in early in the morning. Our room was not ready, but the staff at the front desk invited us to have a snack at the executive lounge. As our room still was not ready, they were kind enough to upgrade us to a junior suite. The room was excellent. The hotel has an outdoor pool on the 13th floor. There is a very nice restaurant and bar/lounge on the top floor. An extensive breakfast was included. The restaurant staff at breakfast were absolutely outstanding. I would give the whole staff six stars if it was possible. The location adjoins a shopping center and it is convenient to everything in town

This is a great hotel and a step up from other ones we have stayed in Morocco. The rooms were large and very well equipped and the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was well organised and food was good.

I can‚Äôt express how amazing oir stay was!! Thank you for Elhoussaine (he is a star) for the amazing check in experience. From the lounge to the concierge desk Mustafa took amazing care for us! Abdelhamid was absolutely amazing Also big thanks to the rest of the bar, Hamza , Ayoub, Nordin and youssef alami. Two fantastic housekeepers kept our room spotless every day, Fatima and Saida! column3: Hilton - bad experience - they need to focus on the client
column4: Hilton - horrible experience - they need to focus on the client We have very few interactions with hotel staff and when they are less than satisfactory, you are left with a bad taste in your mouth. This is a true definition of 5* hotel, from location, to quality, but the best part of it is the staff and their friendliness. Always willing to help and go above and beyond. We highly recommend this location

Hilton Tangier City Center Hotel and Residences is a fabulous hotel. It was very well appointed. The room was large and clean and very well decorated. Breakfast was very good and had everything an international could want. The staff was attentive and helpful. We would highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

After the 2 years of pandemic its fantastic to get back to some of Hilton's top hotels , hotel Hilton Tanger city being one of them ;-) , Their superb service is still as high as ever, this is a MUST STAY AT location , the food , pool , location and staff are excellent. Their trainee guest manager Hajar was as professional as if she had 10 years experience. She is a credit to the Hilton Hotel group.

Centrally located hotel , clean and spacious rooms , very friendly staff, located near the promenade, nice stroll at night. The hotel has a very nice roof bar . We enjoyed the view , I would use the hotel when ever the occasion arises. The price is very reasonable.

Very nice hotel with good facilities. The staff were very nice. I‚Äôm writing this review for the exceptional service I received from a lady called Hajar who worked in the breakfast area. column3: Amazing service and very dedicated personnel
column4: I am really enjoying staying at this hotel. All personnel is very kind, helpful and very dedicated. I am really feeling like staying at home. column3: Best hotel in an amazing location!
column4: I stayed with my husband and 5 children. Check in check out process was very smooth! Hotel staffs were amazing, very friendly and helpful! We felt very welcomed! Room and breakfast were amazing! Location is excellent! Very recommended!

column3: A great option if you want access to Tangier!
column4: The staff was very conscientious about cleanliness and safety during the pandemic, and maintained a warm professionalism that felt welcoming and helpful as well as making me feel safe during my recent travels. I hope to return and stay in the future!

I literally feel like home as i visit the hotel frequently .The service fits perfectly with a 5 * hotel. Breakfast time is great due to the kind service of all the staff (special thanks to Ilham & meriem). Great housekeeping service quality without forgetting Ms fatimazohra Elmhouar and its reactivity availability and kindeness. Big thanks to all the hilton tangier city center team that i didn't mentioned by name but do a wonderful job. Just keep doing things as you do.

column4: The review concerns only a 1 night stay. Basically a very good hotel compared to what I already experienced in tanger. Very clean and confortable, staff very nice and professional. The restaurant has good food although the menu is very short and doesn't offer many options, I would say it's pretty basic and very expensive for what it is. column3: Best hotel in Tangier by so far

If your are looking for the best room in tanger city you must try this hotel with the best concierge service ever. special thanks to Mustafa from the hotel concierge. Amazing experience thank you Hilton.

State of the art Hotel with top facilities and highly skilled and trained personnel. From check in to check out and in between, everything was top notch. Friendly and accommodating staff, great hot breakfast, Very clean rooms, located in the city center and close to everything. Nice and large rooms Very clean rooms Excellent breakfast Nice pool but not not heated: a bad surprise! Good gym facilities: well equipped Professional staff eager to make customers satisfied Not centrally located but taxi are inexpensive and bullet train station is 200 meter from the hotel!

column3: Could not fault our stay here.

Lovely hotel but here for two nights, last night this evening, my air conditioner does not work. Will not cool. Someone came and ‚Äòfixed it‚Äô but now back in room and not cool. Have rang three or four times to guest services with no answer. Not what you expect from Hilton.

All was good, but it was one problem, it‚Äôs the carte, sometimes not working, so you should go and give it to fixe it, but all other things was good service all clean good food nice chambre beautiful rooftop

column3: Kindly staff and verry good service!

My brilliant visit to marvelous city Tangier. It is a brilliant hotel that I can recommend for every body. The location of this hotel is excellent. The staff is friendly. The hotel is very clean. The breakfast is excellent

Not a big deal though, but it would have gotten 5 stars otherwise.

I just loved my visit here. Mustafa, the concierge, was incredibly resourceful and made me laugh a lot. The views were astounding, and I loved practicing my Arabic with some kids in the lobby who responded to my Arabic with perfect English. Tangier is a beautiful city, and spending the day at this beautiful hotel in the company of Mustafa and other wonderful staff members made the 12 hour train trip from Tangier to Marrakech extremely tolerable. I freshened up at the remarkable hotel just before alighting the midnight train making my overnight travel restful and easy. Thanks again Mustafa!!!

column3: simply a breathtaking and memorable experience
column4: Where to begin? This was an amazing trip, never have been in Morroco before and thanks to the Hotel it highlighted the beauty of Tangier and the trip even more so. From the first moment of arriving it went swiftly and flawlessly. Would like to take this opportunity to thank the staff who work there who all helped in creating a wonderful experience especially (younes, yasine, doha and imad!!). If you have a chance do book the King Junior Suite! The room is perfect, as well as the executive rooms. Also worth mentioning, housekeeping who have done a great job in tidying the room spotless clean, as well as the breakfast team for providing such an amazing breakfast at the 15th floor with a magnificent view to the sea. Anyway this review is already way too long and some readers will‚Ä¶

Excellent service, friendly staff and great location... was a pleasure to stay there and experience Morocco in a comfortable setting with excellent air conditioning and friendly and competent staff. Would stay again.

Shower booth door is broken and led to water leakage. Other than that everything was very good and up to standard. Pool is excellent and very timely check in and out. Excellent services by the staff. Free parking as well.

Fabulous stay I was extremely happy with my stay, the food was fabulous, the service exceptional, the beds comfy and the facilities more than adequate. All the staff I spoke with were helpful, friendly and very professional. A most comfortable stay! I would like to to thank Fatima zahra for her great service,Amin really he is a lovey man ,Hafsa at the breakfast area were very helpful.thanks to Mohammed at the front desk. The housekeeper were excellent (sorry I forgot her name ) Thanks everyone .

column3: Amazing dinner & stay at this Hilton!
column4: The Las Kasbah restaurant was an amazing Chicken and Lemon Tangine. Badr was an amazing waiter and took care of everything from the wine selection to the tangine! The overall experience was amazing from booking local visits as well as the hotel amenities including a great rooftop bar and pool. I would highly recommend this location and hotel for any tourists looking for an exceptional quality of service away from home. Breakfast is also delicious so I recommend having that every day!

I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel enough. It‚Äôs a beautiful place situated in ideal location. The staff is really amazing and the Concierge is really helpful. I forgot my bag and he made every effort possible to get it back to me on time. The rooms are lovely, spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms are modern and spacious and the lobby and other areas are really beautiful. The roof top restaurants is spectacular and the breakfast is really amazing. Everything is 5 star.

Very simple words This hotel is perfect for : family ,business location centre service great values Big room is very clean , Close to the airport 20 minutes very nicely. cool view from the breakfast 15th floor

Excellent rooms, well appointed ans a lovely rooftop pool and restaurant. Superb breakfast at the restaurant upstairs, really incredible The staff is superb and the manager Samr made all the difference. She took care of our issues, and exceed our expectations in every way. Samr you are 10/10, best manager I have encountered in 23 years of weekly business travel around the world. Well done and thank you again !

We sadly booked by mistake - (and which is beyond terrible) - the Hilton Garden Inn which is the sister hotel and right next door to) the Hilton Tanger City Centre Hotel & residences. We had a truly terrible time in our hotel as the service was beyond disgusting and we were upset, so we went into the Hilton Tanger City Centre knowing that we would be getting a superior service. We were not wrong. We met by chance the Restuarant Manager - Saad Chhiyar as we were looking to have dinner in the hotel. He was beyond wonderful and helpful. He, along with Badr - our absolutely delightful waiter went above and beyond to look after us and absolutely treated us like royalty. We had a wonderful evening with fantastic service and food that was absolutely delicious - I had the warm‚Ä¶

We had a great stay at the Hilton. The hotels facilities and rooms are all beautiful and the two rooftop terraces and bar and stunning. Special mention in particular to Omar at the Kasbah who is one of the most welcoming, attentive and friendly people we met in Tanger and across Hilton stays! Not forgetting Imad, Sara and Nada who met all our questions with a smile and were great to see going in and out! Thank you - Gareth & Bea

Had a very distasteful check in experience where my wife when asking the security guard where the entrance to check in. He rudely suggested we are at the wrong Hilton as this is "5 star" and to go to the garden in pointing the direction to walk in. Despite this disrespectful and distasteful experience. Me and my family got to enjoy the friendly staff and service at breakfast and the pool. My advice is if you have a family expect the pool to have limited space to sit down on the sun beds or even a chair but only at peak times. Location of this hotel is perfect and the staff are really happy and have a great grasp of English.

Good overall HOTEL service with nice quite and clean rooms. Fine restaurant with sufficient choice. Breakfast is excellent with fresh products and lot's of choice. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

I love to stay agin in the hotel and l i will soon. And thanks for every member who work in the hotel to make as happy and fell relax and safe withe you i wish you all the beat and i wish i can make a one day to dinner withe the whole workers.

column3: Poor standards for a Hilton hotel
column4: Much to be upgraded here. Firstly the carpets in the foyer have a damp smell making the whole area smell bad. No tissue boxes in the rooms and a small variety of cosmetics. The lounge had only buts and desserts to snack on. The evening light snacks were very limited as well. Breakfast was 5 star. Pool area was lovely but very cold due to it being on the 15th floor.

PROS: Location [at one end of the waterfront walk] The Hotel is fresh, modern and comfortable. Transportation options are just outside, a Shopping Mall is attached. The Beach is a couple of blocks away. Breakfast is Excellent [including fresh brewed Mint Tea]! In the Breakfast Lounge Khalid [Asst. Mgr.] was exceptionally attentive to our needs. A special 'send-off' was unexpected but encapsulated the fun/enjoyable time at the hotel! CONS: n/a SUGGESTIONS: n/a

If your on the Costa Del Sol ( Spain ) or want somthing new , the trip to Tangers and a stay at the Hilton Tanger City Center Hotel is a MUST. Using this hotel as a base to the city of Tangers is easy to navigate into the old town or beach front. It is minutes from the ferry terminal by taxi. The Hotel itself is amazing, great rooms, super pool & chill area on the 13th floor and the breakfast on the 15th floor is amazing , of course thanks to Khalid and his staff who has many years experience in WW 5 star hotels , he is a super professional. The exec lounge is well stocked for a quite drink before heading out to dinner. In summary , go to Tangers , stay at the Hilton Tanger City Center hotel for a 100% amazing experience not to mention the value !. From a HH Diamond member.

I need to start by saying that this Hilton Resort truly deserves 10 Stars and the reasons for that are endless! Me and my husband stayed there last month for 4 great nights! The service from Front Desk, Housekeeping, Food & Beverage (Breakfast) Hosts, to Clerks is beyond amazing! Everybody was trained really well and knew what they were doing. Ibtissam, was the front desk agent who checked us in, very courteous, helpful and professional. She got us a nice room with a city view. Great amenities! We had breakfast all 4 mornings at the beautiful La Terrace restaurant with spectacular sea views: All hosts provided us with amazing service all throughout our stay: Meryem is a gem, amazing big smile and she would go above and beyond to get us what we would fancy, especially with my‚Ä¶

This hotel exceeded my expectations by all means! The location, service, dining, and rooms are quality and truly worth it if you are staying in Tanger. I would be happy to return again! The breakfast buffet and views to the ocean were some of the highlights of my stay! Overall, PHENOMENAL experience!

Hilton Tanger City is a wonderful, well-appointed facility, beautiful, adjacent to a large shopping mall and a large public transportation hub. About 30 minutes walk to the old Medina, but only one block to a pretty, large public beach.

column3: Great location, excellent staff, nice property
column4: I have to begin with a disclosure: I am a lifetime Platinum Marriott rewards member with current Titanium status. I don‚Äôt stay at Hiltons unless there IS no Marriott in town, as was the case here. Having said that, I was impressed with most of what the Hilton Tangier City Center Hotel & Residences had to offer during my stay. I also had my status matched to Hilton Diamond, so I was given a club floor room and don‚Äôt know if that had an impact on the stay or not. The good: staff service was excellent in room service (Kawtor was the sweetest room attendant, who not only serviced the room but provided extra touches like rose petals on the bed, a daily note, and a nice curtain display), and the front desk and concierge employees spent extra effort in tracking down a lost suitcase‚Ä¶

Well, we screwed up - twice and book either the wrong Hilton or on a wrong night. However, no need to worry. The front desk manager and other staff are amazing. They quickly swooped in both times and did everything they could help. Incredible service. Also, the hotel is incredibly clean, modern, and has stunning views. Stay here!!!

I'll start with the pro's The housekeeping was amazing! Truly 5 star hotel quality. The beds were comfortable and the room was a decent size. The room Service staff were polite both taking the orders and delivery. The food was good 1 time and terrible the next. The conceirge guys were all really polite and efficient. Cons There was no turn down service. Even though I called and asked on the 1st day they said yes of course there is about 10 mins later a guy showed up at the door with 2 towels. We were tired from an entire day out and couldn't be bothered insisting. We never got a turn down service in the 5 days. We constantly had to keep asking for clean towels. As we like to shower in the morning and evening. In a hot country I dont think its extraordinary! One evening we‚Ä¶

Great location, close to the beach and shopping mall. Rooms are perfect (clean, large, complimentary water bottles, kettle, tea/coffee) nice view of Tanja main train station. Staff are very professional and lovely especially the house keepers Fatima zahra and Sukaina. Whenever I go back to my room at the end of the day, I find a towel with beautiful decorative shape on the bed and bathroom. Not too expensive for Hilton. The only downside is that they don‚Äôt have spa. The restaurant in the 15th floor is very delicious with convenient prices.

Took my second trip this year to Tangier, and stayed again at the Hilton Tanger Hotel. Exec floor is superb. EVERY single employee makes you feel special. Breakfast is outstanding -- both the food, and the view from the restaurant overlooking that incredible corniche of the bay. Two employees were especially noteworthy: Jamal in F&B is attentive, friendly, eager to please, and seems always to have a smile on his face. In all the Hilton properties I've visited, he is one of the finest employees I've met, always seeking to help you feel welcome with a little extra energy. And Mustafa at the front desk was a font of information. His quick action when an unexpected 'oops, I drank the water' reaction occurred helped my last two days at the hotel be bearable. Who knew that‚Ä¶

If you‚Äôre hesitating between this and another hotel, I do not recommend this one. We chose this hotel based on the great reviews, and the amenities offered. we wish we had gone with our initial choice. The hot tub was not hot, it was barely warm. After a full day of walking around, I was really looking forward to the hot tub, so this was very disappointing. The sauna and steam room were also not hot. When we returned to the room after being out and about, it was so filled with cigarette smoke that we had to ask to be moved to a different room! On a positive note, the staff were friendly and helpful!

We had an amazing stay at the Hilton. The staff was extremely courteous. I must make a special mention about Mustafa from travel desk. He went out of the way to make our stay and travel arrangements very pleasant and took very good care of us. I rate the experience fantastic.

the staff was the most friendly and welcoming i have ever seen in Morocco. from the cleaning ladies, front desk , pool and check in. the hotel is very big and well decorated. perfect for a short stay or even to go to the beach which is not far

Place of peace, well located in the center of the city variety of entertainment choices, outings and excursions. Near the Mall and the Train station. Good value for money Staff is attentive and caring.

Amazing Hotel. Perfect location. Just in front of the train station. Shops around. Great staff. Spend one night there with 2 teenagers. Amazing view. Tangier is a beautiful city. Will definitely come back.

I just come back from 1 week holidays with friends in Tangier. This hotel is amazing , great staff (always happy if they can help with something) Special thanks too Mustafa - consergie , Meryam- breakfast and Sabba-housekeeping, they did amazing job with taking care of as . Hotel is very clean and has magical Maroccan atmosphere. I had there the best Maroccan Tea with lovely view.

The roof top pool and the top floor restaurant are great. There is also a bar on the 15th floor. Food at La Kasbah was very good, with a great view and ambiance. Our waiter, Badr, was the perfect host. Highly recommended.

column3: Very nice hotel in great location
column4: Perfect location. Very nice customer service. Hotel is clean and well decorated. The rooms, beds and pillows were very comfortable. Absolutely silent at night. Good food from the room-service menu. All-in-all this is a nice hotel at a fair price.

column3: Front Desk Agents needs Guest Service Training
column4: The hotel is perfectly located across from train station. The hotel is nice, clean and comfy. As a Diamond member the executive lounge is not worth the visit. Comparing my stays with Marriott as platinum member or other Hilton Brands. We left to Casablanca and checked into HyattRegency and used the club room for breakfast and sunset and it was excellent for food and wine. We stayed 5 nights at Hilton Tangier and each night was different in the executive lounge. The food was old and dried up tasteless for lite bites. My biggest compliant is the front desk while checking out. Maybe it‚Äôs a cultural thing. When my partner was asking questions about our bill at check out she didn‚Äôt really care. Stay off the phone while you are with a guest and make sure the guest is helped. ‚Ä¶

I am a Hilton HHonors diamond and I stay in their properties at least twice a month. This is the best Hilton and one if the best hotels I ever stayed in worldwide hands down Ask for Meryam at F&B. She is the best of the best of the best. She checks on you every few minutes and very very patiently explains the Moroccan dishes and when and how they eat them. She still make sure everyone is taken care of but still gives everyone the time and the right service. I extended one extra day because of her and the guy at the pool but I do not remember his name. BOTH are golden as well as everyone else Great place

I had a layover here on my way out of Tetouan going back to the US. It was conveniently located and I could see the train station out my window. located in the same building as a mall and a movie theater. Front desk and executive level concierge soke English, Spanish and French.

column3: Good Stay, Excelent Instalations...but Mediocre Service
column4: Located at the right place to visit the most popular areas of Tanger, Hilton Tanger will offer you excellent and modern facilities. The personal is not as efficient as a hotel of such a category requires. Receptionist are very bad... lack of skills in languages and, overall, a lack of attitude to help at all. First face you have... the worst. Those who have experience show a bit a certain degree of sufficiency over the other colleagues who doesn't. With some exceptions: Mohammed, taking care of luggage, very good, I would say, excellent compared to receptionists. The cleaning and room arrangements are magnificent!!... I would like to mention Ms Nadia and Ms Jihane. We got our room very well prepared, anytime. Thank you! As a suggestion for other travelers, cross your fingers‚Ä¶

This was not my most disappointing stay, but still quite disappointing. I am a Diamond member who has stayed at over 60 different Hilton properties in the last couple years and 25 of them were mainstay Hilton‚Äôs Hotels. I am quite familiar with Hilton Worldwide brand standards and what amenities and standards of service are found at a mainstay Hilton location. This hotel overall did not feel ‚Äúupper-upper class‚Äù as defined by Hilton brand identity. The check-in process is a poor first impression. The desk area has no Honors check-in (brand standard requirement?) and there were multiple displeased people waiting in line to be helped. My wife and I walked in with our packs and waited in line for 15 minutes. This felt like a long time to wait to check-in, only to be told that as an‚Ä¶

The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Always inquiring if everything meets my expectations, which they did. Houda, Housekeeping Badr, Food & Beverage and Mohammed, Bellman were outstanding individuals consisently exceeding the guest's expectations daily. I really appreciated their customer advocacy.

column3: Worst Check In and Staff Experience
column4: Check in at this hotel is the worst that I have ever experienced. The front desk receptionist Mounir greeted us very coldly and repeatedly answered calls as we tried to check in, completely ignoring us. After we informed him multiple times of the room we have, he continued to be dismissive and rude. I then asked for the manager who was not helpful either. The manager, Adil Ait Lazark came and was of even less assistance. He began by saying this is a ‚Äúbusiness hotel‚Äù and that we might be at the wrong hotel. When we tried to show our reservation on our phone he began being aggressive to my boyfriend and I to the point I wanted to cancel my reservation and find another hotel. He insisted that we were wrong without looking into it himself. There was a group of 4 of us with a‚Ä¶

It has everything you can expect from a hotel of this level. Good rooms with comfortable beds, big bathroom with nice towels. I can only comment as negative that the bathrooms do not have toothpaste ;) It would be a nice and easy improvement for the clients. The executive pack allows you to enter an exclusive lounge with good service in one of the highest floors of the hotel.

Superb Hotel in every way Perfect. Superb hotel in a great location. Staff can‚Äôt do enough to help and are genuinely friendly and always smiling. Thanks to the lovely lady at the breakfast Lounge Amal she is professional,she knows how to provide a Good customer services,a big thanks to all the members of staff (sorry I forgot their names ) at the breakfast lounge. The Food was very good ,very nice Room with nice view. Thanks to Sara at the executive lounge she‚Äôs Smiling all the times. Thanks to the concierge Imad ,thanks to all members of staff at the front office.

Good place and good peaple in the hotel , Mounir from the reception is very helpful and nadia from the housekeeping graves verry good job thank you hilton merci hilton Il a remerci√© le service de chambre sp√©cial pour la chor√©graphe Nadia ÿ¥ŸÉÿ±ÿß ŸáŸäŸÑÿ™ŸàŸÜ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ∂ŸäÿßŸÅÿ© ‚ù§Ô∏è

It always begins with the staff in the service industry doesn‚Äôt it! Our first face of this Hilton was Fatima. She appeared genuinely pleased to Great us. The whole sign in process was was smooth. Including their offer of fine Tea. Fatima upgraded our room to Executive and all with a smile. We were also served by Youness, Gihan and Imad. Each played a role in setting up a taxi for dinner, their steam room and the following day for out of town visit, made simpler by charging to our room. This large hotel made us feel welcome. The Rooms were elegant and modern. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend The Hilton Tanger City Hotel.

We finished our Morocco trip in Tangier and the Hilton was everything we hoped for. While we did Riads in both Fes and Marrakesh, I opted for Hilton in Tangier to be assured of a quality stay. They lived up to our expectations. Our room faced the sea with a slight sea view. On higher floors the view is better. There is a spectacular view from breakfast. The executive lounge has decent food and drinks but the staff is a bit lazy and regularly had to be asked to refill both food and drinks. The front desk was very helpful and arranged guide and car to tour the caves, cape and Medina. There were four of us so the price for private car was very reasonable. We also used their van to Casablanca airport. This was very competitively priced for our group. The buffet at breakfast was‚Ä¶

I enjoyed staying at the Tanger Hilton last year, and was looking forward to my return visit. There was some delay at check in, but this was due to a central computer system, and the reception staff dealt with it as quickly as they could, and we have a room with a gorgeous city view. Unfortunately there was a problem with the heating and cooling system, which after several attempts by staff, could not be adjusted. When they realized this would require mechanical repairs in the room, Doha at reception immediately arranged for us to be moved, and Adil Lazrak, the front office manager, stepped in and upgraded our room to a lovely suite. This gesture made this a great experience, instead of a disappointing one, and shows how friendly and professional customer service is what makes‚Ä¶

The Hilton Hotel is situated across the road from the train station and right next door to the Tanger City Mall. Couldn‚Äôt have chosen a better location. Like all Hilton‚Äôs, this one was of the standard that you‚Äôd expect - breathtaking views from the restaurant (overlooking the port and across the ocean you can spot Spain), room was clean, modern and sleek and service was great. What a pleasure to stay here. Will definitely recommend and hopefully be back again!

column3: Clean and tidy but service was excellent
column4: We picked this hotel because of its reasonably central location. As expected from the name the hotel was clean and tidy with nothing wanting in the reasonable spacious room. But what stood out in this hotel was the service. All the staff, and I mean all - from managers to porters and room housecleaners were so happy to help and they all spoke fluent English, Spanish and French. We also booked for the new year party there. This was just great as an entry into 2019.

column3: Great if you love ciggie smoke
column4: Let's do the good first. The staff were friendly and helpful The restaurant was a little pricey and the menu was limited We tended to eat at the Hilton garden where the menu catered much better for children and the food prices were more reasonable Now the bad. Having travelled extensively, why is it the hotels have a lingering smell of cigarettes in the bedrooms in this day an age. Why is it these places particularly the Middle East countries think it's acceptable to allow people to smoke in bars. This smoke then lingers into the bedrooms and then you spend the night coughing and leave the hotel with your clothes smelling like an ash tray. I paid good money to enjoy the comforts of a good hotel and sadly this was not what I catered for. Will not be retuning in a hurry.

I had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton‚Äôs hotel for a weekend and i liked it very much. Spacious room, good amenities, friendly and helpful staff, amazing food (my weakness was their breakfast in bed). Other than few miner details that could be easily resolved like the housekeeping staff knocking on door even with a do not disturb sign on (was on a Skype meeting with my boss so it was kind of awkward leaving to open the door right in the middle of it) or the loud music coming all way from 15th floor where restaurant and bar were to the 8th floor disturbing the calm atmosphere of the night and the water that leaks to the room each time i shower.... everything else is so good that these kind of set back did not matter at all. Hotel near by train station and beach, right in‚Ä¶

Best hotel in tangier, hands down. A different level of quality than youll find anywhere else. The only place that is even close is the the hilton other around the corner. Great service and amazing value.

column3: Perfect choice for my first time in Morocco
column4: Perfect choice for my first time in Morocco. I was in Tanger at the end of November for my first time in Morocco. What‚Äôs better than Hilton Tanger City Center? Everything it was perfect and the staff was so kind and available for everything. The room was very comfortable and, when we arrived, our table was full of macaroons, biscuits, fruit and rose petals as a ‚Äúwelcome surprise‚Äù. The bed was so fluffy and every morning it was really hard to get up! The flagship of Hilton Tanger City Center is La Kasbah restaurant. We tried it for breakfast, lunch and dinner during our stay and it was every time better than the last one. I loved especially cheese croquets and beef fillet. Last but not least: pool and Jacuzzi! Such a relaxing area with a breathtaking view, perfect after all day‚Ä¶

column3: The hotel is amazing the location is awesome
column4: I really had great time here in teger the hotel us amazing I really loved how nice the crew are speacillay Maryam, Hajar , Jehan they always took care of us.... and people from reception Imad , Hisham ,,, they were there every time I needed them ... am coming back here for sure

Couldn't Imagine a better place where to begin our vacation in Morocco. The place is perfectly located (right in front of the train station and 7 minutes walk to the corniche), stylish, elegant, clean and features a huge rooftop pool with jacuzzi, a well equipped gym and a wonderful restaurant with a view all over the coast. The executive lounge is also super equipped with coffee machine, many snacks, bakery treats, a nice view and 2 laptops both Apple and Lenovo so that It can satisfy Windows lovers like me or iOS dipendents like my girlfriend. Breakfast buffet is endless and the staff is wonderful from the front desk to the waiters at the restaurant. The managers were also super kind and ready to help us in everything. Thanks a lot for the love, all the best for you all‚Ä¶

The hotel is clearly a five star hotel. Service was amazing. The concierge was exceptional and gave great recommendations. The restaurant on the 15th fo has beautiful views and breakfast was Moroccan and Mediterranean with good coffee. The lounge was comfortable and the beds were comfortable. Highly recommend it.

I have stayed here for 5 Nights, this hotel is outstanding with the service starting from reception, concierge, Executive lounge and the restaurant. I would like to mention Meryem from Khasbah restaurant, she is an asset to the hotel for her excellent service, she made our morning start with a smile and went far and beyond to offer that exceptional experience. Also Aziz Executive lounge host was outstanding always helpful and available to serve. Also Ayemane from concierge was great. I had a problem in the room , however the team dealt with it so professionally and quickly that did not affect my stay at all. Simply love this hotel and the team at this hotel make a massive difference. Thank you team Hilton Tangier for the fantastic job!

I visited with my family Nov 2018 and had a fantastic experience. We were greeted promptly and allowed to check in in a timely manner. The property is very well kept, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. The booked tours were memorable, safe and timely. We'd love to visit again.

We stayed here for two nights on our first visit to Morocco. The hotel offers great features and the customary good service of Hilton. The concierge, Imad, helped set up two tours for us. The first was a tour of Tangier which was for a full day. The second was a half day trip to the city of Asilah. Both were private tours with a car and driver provided through the hotel. We had a guide as well for the Tangier tour. It would be tough to tour Tangier without a guide. The tours made for a great visit.

We stayed 2 nights and it was ok. Not more - not less. When we arrived, people at the reception were nice. They told us about the pool area on the 13th floor... Unfortunately the water was not heated and we could not use it. There were no seats and the bar was closed, too. Why are people told to use things that don‚Äôt exist in this time of the year? The room itself was really nice, and comfortable. The sinks in the bathroom were bad smelling. We could not keep the bathroom door closed, otherwise the smell became too bad once you entered the room. We decided to use the sauna and wanted to relax a bit. We had to ask reception to heat the saunas. Unfortunately, it took us 3 calls and 2 h until we got bathrobes. And then they only had the ‚Äúmale sauna‚Äù started, but not the female one.‚Ä¶

The best unexpected experience. Fantastic staff and noteworthy facility. There is nothing that need to be improved upon. Stayed for 3 weeks and enjoyed every minute of it. Wish I had more time to stay

Great prices for this luxury, well situated would highly recommended , great staff very helpful, great dinner restaurant , good breakfast overall very satisfied for my staying and would go back in no time

Our stay at the Hilton was wonderful to say the least. The room was sparkling clean and the amenities were well stocked, the service was impeccable and the complementary water was a great touch. However, the check in process could have been more hospitable as our party arrived earlier than expected but the front desk personnel was not all that welcoming. It wasn‚Äôt the best first impression but apart from that, our stay was perfect. The food service during breakfast was delicious and fresh, the bar service was pretty slow but the drinks were good upon arrival (we waited about 20 minutes for 2 drinks). The concierge was especially helpful as he helped us arrange a day trip to Chefchauoen with an affordable price through a grand Taxi at the very last-minute. At checkout, he also‚Ä¶

Lovely hotel- welcoming reception area and beautiful rooms. Food in the restaurant was tasty. Best in Tangier. Lacking in customer care. Firstly, if you only speak English don‚Äôt expect to be understood by waiters etc. Only staff that speak English are receptionists and managers. Receptionists were too engrossed in their own conversations to engage with us on arrival. Excuse me- we‚Äôre here and don‚Äôt feel welcomed or important. Always seems to be an excuse for the lack of customer care. Pool closed unexpectedly. It was still warm enough to appreciate. Come on Hilton. Manager apologised and we got a free taxi to the airport but I‚Äôd rather have great customer care. You should send your staff to Koi Samui Rock‚Äôs Boutique Hotel or Gloria Serenity in Belek, Turkey. You feel special‚Ä¶

The hotel is very nice and the staff is super friendly. Beds are comfy and the most important part is that the hotel‚Äôs location is perfect, near to the beach and to the Tangier M√©dina. I would definitely book the same hotel when in Tangier.

Unfortunately I've got robbed here. Just in front of the the hotel where are at least 3 security guys standing. Makes me wondering if they also weren't involved in this incident. The police refused to come so I had made my way to the police station. At least hotel had some decency not to charge me for hotel car to get there. Only one manager were helpful another just pretended he cared. I advised my company about this unfortunate situation. And hopefully they will change the accommodation for safer place. Room: The drain in shower was constantly clogged. Executive lounge: The worst selection of food and drinks I've seen in Hilton in my 12 years travel. Security: As mentioned before. There is no need to be there. Breakfast: Inconsistent service with limited choice

column3: Worst Hilton of 20+ I've stayed in ...
column4: Room Service - Completely useless: 4 attempts to bring my son some toast, 1st attempt toast cut into some lattice effect as though just from an episode of Masterchef, 2nd attempt toasted rolls, 3rd attempt toasted rolls, 4th attempt toast, total time wasted 2 hours, son was asleep when it finally arrived. Another toast attempt, 1 hour later and nothing. Pool - ICE COLD in September: Not heated at all and a complete waste of time, we left before we were attacked by a polar bear. Housekeeping - Inconsistent and poor: What they did, they did well, unfortunately they often didn't replace shampoo etc and then we were waiting for hours for replacements to be sent up. Executive Lounge - Great for a meat eater: Daily executive suite 5pm snacks and drinks suited a meat eater but 5‚Ä¶

Very luxurious equipment and service. Friendly personnel. Cosy and confortable rooms. Location is interesting, next to the beach and a little mall. Ideal for couples or a quick visit to Tangier. Avoid food on the rooftop.

On the 15 floor , at the Hilton hotel , is the main international and local restaurant , we tried the local menu, it was not up to our expectations, the service was not classy , the view was good , i will not go back again.

column3: Typical Semi-Upscale Western Chain Hotel. Rates 4.5
column4: PROS: - Staff was friendly and helpful (with exception of one young, clueless, concierge). I dealt mostly, but not exclusively, with the executive lounge staff - I used points, and my stay included complimentary breakfast, complimentary happy hour until 8:00, beverages during the day, executive floor room. So amazing value - Huge rooftop pool deck with comfortable seating, bar service - Serves alcohol - They changed hotel rooms for me - Slightly larger-than-average sleeping rooms - Clean, quiet natural light from large windows - Wifi available throughout - Nice breakfast spread CONS - Very few other tourists here: mostly locals. I like meeting other travelers when I stay at a hotel - My first room (non-smoking) smelled of cigarette smoke. The common areas (elevators,‚Ä¶

column3: Raciest, No attention to Detail, Poor Housekeeping 1/2 Star property posing as a 5 Star. Petty!
column4: Vacation of a lifetime, partially ruined by this property. During Check-Inn, I started talking to the front desk, what I assume to be locals (as they were speaking Arabic) came up behind us, were brought forward, we were moved to the side and they were checked in ahead of us. When I did get to the front desk, I was told we have an executive floor room (as I HAD been a loyal diamond member of Hilton). There was no visible sign to hint there was a second check in area for diamond members. We went to 13th floor. No one was at the executive desk. We waited, A person did show up 5 min later. But they had NO keys! So she called to get keys (funny she called and called many numbers before getting a answer, should have been a tip off to us, even the hotel staff cant get proper‚Ä¶

We booked this hotel aiming for a pleasant stay and we found the opposite. Although rooms were spacious and bed was comfortable, the hotel did not offer what we were looking for. Breakfast was like a jungle, full of kids crying and running around and nobody did anything. Furthermore, it was difficult to find a table and usually we had to wait for 20 minutes or more. Additionally, we found difficult to find someone who speak English at the hotel (namely at the pool and the bar/restaurant). At the reception, we wanted to change euros to dirhams and it wasn't possible, even though they told me it was possible by email before our arrival. Lastly, one day we wanted to use the computer and the printer at the reception but they didn't work. Swimming pool was crowded and full of kids‚Ä¶

List of things not ok is long. Shower stinking because water not going away, housekeeping not able one single time to leave all in place (missing soap, missing towels), room not done at 4 pm (I should have asked to...), incredible poor quality of the restaurant (finding available food was like a bingo). Difficult to think about a next stay here!

First the good things - the best onion soup in La Kasbah restaurant I've had in years and a terrific view with really good service throughout the hotel; I watched this get built over the past years. The bad things - the rooftop pool is tiny, shallow and useless for all but children under three. Any room lower than fifth floor has no view at all. Parking, though good when you get in, entails complicated entry every time. All in all, an OK hotel but nowhere near as good as it should be, mainly because of the terrible pool - don't be fooled by the photos.

Stayed for 1 night on a recent business visit. Great modern and comfortable rooms. Lounge and pool area on 13th floor with nice atmosphere and great views. Good breakfast selection. Prices very moderate for a hotel of this category.

column3: Secure, Relaxing, beautiful views, great location, nice and very clean spacious rooms
column4: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much. Great amenities, secure and prefect location. A bit pricy, other than that I have no complaints! Train station right across the street, close to the port, can literally walk to the ferry if going to and from Spain and not too far from the airport.

column3: amazing hotel with superb roof deck
column4: I must admit that I was a little nervous to travel to Morocco at first. This hotel was my last stop on my tour . What an AMAZING hotel. The customer service is fantastic....a special thank you to the man in charge of transportation (can't remember his name) he went above and beyond to help me with a last minute airport transfer. Front desk was great. Views from the roof deck were great...What else can I say? I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Tangier!!!!!

column3: Wonderful base to explore Tangier and Chefchaouen
column4: Stayed in a one-bedroom suite with my wife and our niece. It was a great choice since the room had two bathrooms and showers, a king bed and a sofa bed. Moreover, the Hilton offers free parking which was important to us since we were driving around Morocco. The area where the Hilton located is very modern. While the hotel is a 10 to 15 minute car ride from the Medina, it is a 5 minute walk to the beach, and the shopping center is right next to the hotel. The food at the hotel was very good. Breakfast is buffet style with a wide variety of choices including eggs cooked to order. We also had dinner one night at the top floor restaurant. The seafood tajine and chicken pastilla were both fresh and tasty. Would definitely stay here again.

column3: Average hotel, not very charming. Poor service.
column4: Tangier can be a very charming city, and the City Center Hilton is located far away from anything remotely fascinating. It's in a "business" area of the city (assuming anyone would go to Tangiers for business). The rooms are ok, clean and comfortable. The service is not very good, the reception is small and understaffed. I had to wait quite a long time to check in. The restaurant staff is very slow and not very attentive. They seem to be busy doing something else, or doing their own thing, and totally disinterested in looking after the guests.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of June. He had to attend 3 days of business meetings here and it was just vacation for me. I really would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Tangier. Very good location, about 30 minutes from the airport. Taxis are very inexpensive so transportation wherever we needed to go was not an issue. Food at the hotel was very delicious. Traditional moroccan dishes as well as American food was available. Breakfast buffet offered many options. The rooftop pool is gorgeous and the lounge chairs very welcoming. I spent quite a few afternoons by the pool. Club at night was fun. Several nights they had a DJ with dancing. My husband and I hung out there most nights and had a few drinks before bed. We stayed in room‚Ä¶

I really loved this hotel , it‚Äôs my first visit to Tangier and I had a great stay at Hilton . Professional stuff and very friendly. The food is tasty and fresh . The gym is perfect . And i will specially thank the housekeeping team for their professionalism and for keeping my room always clean and smelling great . Thank u all

I frequent this hotel from time to time with my wife because of the 13th floor pool and because of its location even though we have a flat down the street from here. I love the building the rooms as well as the service (most of the time). Only have 2 things to say wifi in room 378 isn't good the range isn't strong enough( that can be improved) the executive lounge should have more items accessible throughout the day( that's my opinion of course), besides that the hotel and staff are awesome always smiling and wanting to help. Like I said the rooms are comfy and clean always. The 13th floor with the open terrace/patio are with the pool and bar is AMAZING I will continue to frequent this hotel as I just love it. Thank you for everything. The picture is of me in the pool on the‚Ä¶

One of the best hotels i have vested , friendly staff especially the house keeping team ( MEUNIA ) at the 5th floor . Mehdi the bartender works very hard to make us happy all the time . Hossam the bar manager is a very professional person I advise all tangier tourists to stay at this hotel they will never regretted .

I m staying in this hotel for a long time and i would like to congratulate the staff for the Quality of the service, the kindness of the team, The smiling face of all the crew . It is a nice place to land if you are looking for relax atmosphere and good treatment.

The good: The front desk was very friendly and helpful, specially the concierge. The room was nice and accommodating, not huge but not tiny. It's walking distance to the beach if that's your thing. There is a mall next door with a good grocery store. That's about the only thing that is walking distance. The bad: Now keep in mind that we were here during Ramadan, which may or may not have been an influence. Obviously, this is an American hotel chain so you would expect liquor to be available and it was sort of. We tried twice to get a drink and we failed both times. First time was at the lobby "bar", it turns out this is mostly a coffee bar but when you walk up and look at the menu it's full of alcoholic drinks, so I selected one and asked the "bar maid" for the drink, she acted‚Ä¶

Tanger was excellent hilton is perfect! Location was great people is friendly room is very Clean and wonderful place it was a pleasure to see everything from closer view. Next time i come back to the same hotel!

After staying in 4 so called 5 star hotels(they were not) in a Morroco tour our last hotel was the Hilton. Just looking at it from the outside was impressive. Going inside we were welcomed by the courteous staff. Most spoke more than one language. Our room was very comfortable with a bathroom taken out of a designers magazine. Breakfast and lunch buffet, exquisite. This was our best stay by far.

column3: Recommend highly...Comforts of home in Morocco!
column4: This hotel took away any fears I had of visiting Morocco for the first time. Everything you need to relax and enjoy the Moroccoan culture is here. Loved the art & decorations which reflect the area in this beautiful new hotel in a great location in modern Tangier. The hotel even smelled of a pleasant Moroccoan incense. As a Hilton Diamond Member, I was treated with the highest respect and hospitality. Upon arrival late after traveling from Casablanca, I was greeted with a smile and a room upgrade with a high floor on the executive level with a spectacular view of the water. Room was spotless and well appointed with everything you need. They even called to make sure housekeeping did not miss anything. Breakfast was the highlight of each day. Unbelievable spread each‚Ä¶

Good service, nice and clean rooms. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Fantastic swimming pool and exellant breakfast, I realy enjoy my one week stay in Hilton Tanger city center. Very good location.

column3: Probably the worst service of 7 Hotels we stayed
column4: The stay in the Tanger City Center concludes our 10 day trip of Morocco and Iam really sad to say that this Hotel could not measure up to the others in any terms. From the reception through to agreements made by Hotel reception members. In terms of housekeeping the service was fast and what one can expect from a Hilton. One lady at the reception was also helpful, as well as a few of the greeters, but I‚Äòm glad that this wasn‚Äòt my first stay at a Hilton ...

I recently stayed her for a month for work so I experienced all aspects of the hotel. Pros: Really new, beautifully decorated hotel with some of the friendliest staff I‚Äôve ever encountered. Large, plush, quiet rooms. Great fitness center. Awesome food/dining. Special recognition to the following hotel staff for their superlative attention throughout my stay (thank you, thank you, thank you!!!): ‚Ä¢ In the restaurant: Yahya Bensouda, El Mahdi, El Moouataz, Meryem, Othman, Hamza ‚Ä¢ At the front door: Hicham ‚Ä¢ At the front desk: Coumba Cons: Inconsistent service, particularly by housekeeping. Major municipal construction project in front of hotel so difficult to get to via road and noise/dust during the day. Rooftop bar allows smoking inside and the smell is terrible (the‚Ä¶

column3: A great hotel full of friendly members of team
column4: We have experienced a 6 nights stay at Hilton Tangier, from April 25th to May 1st, 2018. Check-in We were checked in at the Executive lounge located on floor 13. It was a warm and very professional welcome provided by Ghislane: efficiency, smile, she is just at the right place! On the first night, we could not be upgraded (as a Diamond member), but it was done on the second night for one of the 2 bedrooms with a junior suite. Thank you very much for that kind attention. Of course, during all stay, we had access to the Executive lounge. Breakfast time This beautiful hotel is very comfortable and the view so great! Especially at breakfast time, you have 3 major criteria that makes you enjoying this very important time of each day: 1) a true and warm, friendly welcome from the‚Ä¶

The hotel is near the beach and next to the shopping mall; very good location. The hotel room decor is contemporary, we stayed at twin room, the bed is a bit small compare to the other hotels. The restaurant located at the highest 15th flr; we has buffet dinner there, the choices was limited , we didnt enjoyed the food , but the breakfast was good then

We booked this hotel to take advantage of being close to everything in downtown Tangier. It is connected to a mall and the Hilton Garden Inn and access to the beach. The staff was very friendly and they took care of all of our needs. The mint tea and macaroons were delightful, and were offered to us every time we walked past the front desk. The view from the 13th floor pool and 15th floor restaurant are amazing. This is one of the tallest buildings in Tangier so you are guaranteed to get the best view of the city day or night. The rooms were really nice and modern. I really like the showers in the King Suite. If you can request an ocean view room it is worth it to see the ocean in the morning. Also the view of the old city at night is really nice. I stay at a lot of‚Ä¶

column3: Amazing hotel with great views, very good value for money
column4: Breathtaking views, friendly and helpful staff, awesome rooms, the toilet is even better than the rooms itself. The only con that I would mention is the limited options at breakfast. Located right next to a shopping mall.

Stayed for a business trip. Good location, near the ocean, very good security and staff. One restaurant (which also doubles as breakfast room) is at the 15th floor, and has an extraordinary view over the city and the port. Highly recommended for business and other trips.

Me & my wife stayed in for five nights this week, we do enjoy it so much, it‚Äôs wonderful hotel, service so great, people whom working are so great and so welcoming to the guests, and they treat us so nice from hotel entrance and reception, specially Ms. Ghezlan, and her colleagues at reception. They were so friendly to us all the time having smiley faces. Also housekeeper were so nicely and do good job. Also people whom working in breakfast restaurant at 15th floors are so wonderful and the treat just so nicely, especially Mr. Mahdi, Mr. Hamza , Mr. Yahya, and Ms. Ilham, Ms. Meryam, Ms. Hafssa, Ms Radia and Ms. Dounia and also shif Attef all of them were so kindly with us and with all the guests, and food was so great too. Actually every thing was so perfect and so great. Many‚Ä¶

I stayed 2 nights at this hotel and I was extremely happy with the impeccable customer service I got. From the front desk to the restaurant staff and the attendants - all young Moroccan women and men truly professionals working to please the customer. All staff greeted me with a smile and politeness. Bravo to Hilton for finding such talented staff! Will be back soon!

My wife and I had a very pleasant stay at the Hilton Tanger City Center Hotel. A new hotel with very comfortable rooms and lovely views. However, what stood out was the attentiveness of the staff, young, pleasant and eager to assist. I have stayed at both the El Minzah Hotel and Villa de France in the past. Whereas the Hilton may lack their, apathetic staff and old world charm, if you can call it that, it also lacks their old and worn out rooms,apathetic staff and mediocre facilities. My choice in Tangier.

Where do I start. This is a beautiful hotel through and through! We stayed on the Hilton floor in a junior suite and the rooms were superb! The hotel was smartly designed and had all the right amenities for your room! It was my husband‚Äôs birthday and the staff went above and beyond to make his day special! The manager (I don‚Äôt remember her name) was super accommodating and extremely helpful. Imad, the concierge was so gracious and helpful also with arranging flights and assisting us with our needs. I wish I could remember everyone‚Äôs name because the staff was supreme! I would give this hotel 10 stars! If you are looking for luxury and a staff at its finest, look no further. A must stay when in Tangier!

column3: Amazing staff, food, decor. Loved this hotel!
column4: We stayed here last week and had an amazing stay. This is my first review on this site but just could not help myself after our fabulous stay. The staff is phenomenal and take great care to make sure you are happy with their service. They booked a driver for 2 days as well as a fantastic tour guide for us. The food was excellent and the restaurant staff was superb. Overall, the staff provide over the top service and cannot say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay there. It was my birthday and they surprised flowers in our room and a cake and singing at the bar. I have no idea how they knew we would be there but it was very special! I wish all hotels were this accommodating!

We had a very lovely time at Hilton Tanger. The Hotel is new so the building and furnitures are modern and very clean. The executive bedrooms are large and we'll designed. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast restaurant has an amazing view other the sea. The service is really 5 stars. I highly recommend this Hilton Value for money is amazing!

Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights in a quiet month and had an absolutely amazing experience. Almost everything about the venue exceeded our expectations. It is worth noting first that the staff could not have been more helpful, hospitible, or friendlier. All of our needs were met with a smile and most of the staff members spoke impeccable English. Omar at concierge went above and beyond in his role, arranging car hire, rearranging a time to suit us, and even haggled over the price! At a stone's throw from the beach, and situated next door to a large shopping mall, the location was excellent. The views from the restaurant and bar were stunning and the decor was beautiful. We both had a wonderful time, would thoroughly recommend, and definitely wish to return in the‚Ä¶

This is not much of a review as much as it is a shout out for a few people's exceptional service. Chamiae appeared from nowhere to help me while I was the the fitness center and Ahlam saved the day by providing supplies that had been forgotten earlier. Ghizlane is always exceptional at the reception. The barman at the lobby lounge is very good.

What a wonderful stay. We were welcomed into the executive lounge and offered coffee as we checked in. Staff were courteous and helpful. Room was roomy, spotless and we had a lovely view. Food at both dinner and breakfast were great. Can not recommend enough. Very impressed.

After staying at a number of other so called "*5 hotels". in Morocco this hotel was like a breath of fresh air. It is what I would call a *5 hotel. The staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is clean. the rooms are large and have every thing that one would expect in a 5* hotel. The food is varied and very tasty. Would be happy to stay here again.

* The hotel is very new, I guess it is 7-8 months old. Very clean and well designed rooms. * Executive lounge offering nice meals. Staff is excellent, excellent, excellent! Special thanks to Ms.Ghizlane and Ms.Salma for being very helpful and warm. * Location is very good close to the corniche (sea side). * Breakfast was very rich and mouth watering. * I highly recommend this hotel. You can't go wrong with Hilton quality.

Very nice room. The staff are incredibly attentive and nice and helpful. Especially Nawal and Ahlam who are the chamber staff and Imaane at the reception and Adil and Martin who run the hotel. But in all honesty, all the staff are wonderful. Very comfortable rooms, wifi very fast, nice gym and sauna and the breakfast is really good with a good variety on offer. Beds are well made and rooms clean with nice fresh linen. Excellent experience of this hotel.

column3: Very good service! And nice staff!!
column4: This Is the second time I visited the hilton city center. I like the service! Very nice staff. I ask for a other room because my room was to small, the staff Immediately give me a other room. Housekeeper Fatima zohra charaf was the best! She help us to remove our stuff to the other room, and also the ginger girl (i forget her name) was helpful. The staff in reception fatima zohra and aziz where also very helpful, thank you so much!

We have stayed in this hotel for two nights, it is very nice, great location and friendly staff. I will definitely go there again. The pool was under renovation but all the other facilities were great.

I stayed in the Hilton City Center, Tangier/Morocco for two nights during the 25th Annual TEFL Conference November 18th-20th and I am able to say that we had an excellent floor service on the 6th floor. The floor staff are very kind and professional. I do really wish them a great success in this brand-new establishment.

New Hotel, the room was nice I appreciate the fruit basket, it was a nice choice to fresh up before to have business meeting in Tangier, also the breakfast was good and delicious especially the local bakeries üòä

I have never stayed anywhere which delivered such an amazing level of customer service. Staff at this hotel are nothing short of exceptional, always willing to help with the smallest of things. Furthermore, the food in the restaurant was incredible. The facilities the hotel had were also fantastic, the views from the roof top pool area are amazing, being in Africa and being able to see Europe across the sea is something I'll never forget. I had some minor frustrations with my stay that just stop me short of giving it 5 stars. Small things like the bathroom radio didn't work, the sauna was never turned on, the steam room seemed to be broken, bottles of beer in the lounge with no bottle opener. Small things like this and a few others were just a little frustrating. Also when‚Ä¶

As always positive first .. I work for an large USA company and we always stayed at Hilton‚Äôs throughout the world . Great security, executive lounge to relax in , executive floor normally without families, American style breakfast and always great beds and. Huge Bathrooms with baths. This hotel has all that what it doesn‚Äôt have is staff trained in hospitality American style . Check in was hard faffing about, receptionist gossiping to maids no dedicated staff at HH desk.
